definitions.definition: Incapable of being algorithmically decided in finite time. For example, a set of strings is undecidable if it is impossible to program a computer (even one with infinite memory) to determine whether or not specified strings are included.

(of a WFF) logically independent from the axioms of a given theory; i.e., that it can never be either proved or disproved (i.e., have its negation proved) on the basis of the axioms of the given theory. (Note: this latter definition is independent of any time bounds or computability issues, i.e., more Platonic.)
To cause to become completely impregnated, or soaked (especially with a liquid).
definitions.example: After walking home in the driving rain, his clothes were saturated.

definitions.definition: To fill to excess.
definitions.example: Modern television is saturated with violence.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the affinity of; to cause a substance to become inert by chemical combination with all that it can hold.
definitions.example: One can saturate phosphorus with chlorine.

definitions.definition: To render pure, or of a colour free from white light.
A potential problem or source of trouble.
definitions.example: Review the work thoroughly and make sure there are no gotchas.

definitions.definition: An instance of publicly tricking someone or exposing them to ridicule, especially by means of an elaborate deception.
An instance of accomplishing a tricky idea or overcoming a difficult obstacle.
definitions.example: Now here's another few gotchas that you can do to implement it.

definitions.definition: A feature of a system or a program that works in the way it is documented but is counter-intuitive and almost invites mistake or non-function.
definitions.example: Wireless was the first gotcha when installing the distro.

definitions.definition: A pocket handkerchief.
A newly hatched bird, reptile or other animal that has emerged from an egg.
definitions.example: The hatchling alligator had just broken out of its shell but was already trying to follow its mother, who hunted hatchling birds.

definitions.definition: One who reaps.
A machine used to harvest crops.
(often with initial capital) Short for Grim Reaper.
One who molds something into shape.
A person who makes molds.
A tool for making molds.
A machine for making molding.
To decay or rot.
Unfamiliar, strange, foreign.
Clumsy, awkward.
Unrefined, crude.
A type of sewing machine designed to produce an overlock stitch and to cut the fabric as it stitches.
One who, or that which, daubs; especially, a coarse, unskillful painter.
(copperplate printing) A pad or ball of rags, covered with canvas, for inking plates; a dabber.
A type of thick marker pen used to mark a bingo card.
A low and gross flatterer.
The mud wasp; the mud dauber.
The rank or status of a captain.
The jurisdiction of a captain.
An administrative division of the former Spanish and Portuguese colonial empires.
Something that, or someone who, survives or remains or is left over after the loss of others; a relic.
Surviving, remaining.
That is a relict; pertaining to a relict.
A physician who specializes in pediatrics; a children’s doctor or babies’ doctor.
To cry or sob softly and intermittently.
definitions.example: The lonely puppy began to whimper as soon as we left the room.

definitions.definition: To cry with a low, whining, broken voice; to whine; to complain.
To say something in a whimpering manner.
definitions.example: "Master, please don't punish me!" he whimpered.

definitions.definition: The sound of one who whimpers; a whimper; a feeble complaint.
A synthetic compound which acts as a beta blocker and is used to treat hypertension, migraine, and glaucoma.
Any of the most likely winners in a contest, election, etc.
One who engages in front running.
The shortest line between two points on a specific surface.
(spherical geometry) A segment of a great circle.
A course allowing the parallel-transport of vectors along a course that causes tangent vectors to remain tangent vectors throughout that course (a straight curve, a line that is straight).
A shin of beef.
definitions.example: lean sirloin, skink and pot-roast

definitions.definition: A soup or pottage made from a boiled shin of beef.
(by extension) Usually preceded by a descriptive word: a soup or pottage made using other ingredients.
definitions.example: Cullen skink

definitions.definition: A lizard of the family Scincidae, having small or reduced limbs or none at all and long tails that are regenerated when shed.
A drink.
To serve (a drink).
To give as a present.
To print with a stencil.
(usually countable) A tall, tropical Asian perennial herb, Boehmeria nivea, cultivated for its fibrous stems.
(usually uncountable) fibre extracted from this plant, resembling flax.
Form of a word with a stronger or more forceful sense than the root on which the intensive is built.

Any of several (species of) birds, called by this traditional name, mainly in the genus Streptopelia, of the family Columbidae (pigeons and doves, which also included the extinct passenger pigeon and dodos).
Something that portends an event about to occur, especially an unfortunate or evil event; an omen.
A portending; significance
definitions.example: a howl of dire portent

definitions.definition: Something regarded as portentous; a marvel; prodigy.
To render (spoken or written words) into shorthand.
(by extension) To use a brief or shortened way of saying or doing something.
To write in shorthand.
Lacking sufficient staff or people, as for normal or efficient operations.
definitions.example: The tiny restaurant usually got by with three workers on that shift, but found itself shorthanded when the tour bus pulled in.

definitions.definition: Having less than a quorum.
(team sports) Having, or occurring during an interval with, fewer than a full complement of players, often as the result of a penalty.
(of a table) Having fewer than the standard number of players.
In a shorthanded manner.
To cause (a person or animal) to be fat or fatter.
definitions.example: We must fatten the turkey in time for Thanksgiving.

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) To become fat or fatter.
definitions.example: He gradually fattened in the five years after getting married.

definitions.definition: To make thick or thicker (something containing paper, often money).
To become thick or thicker.
To make (soil) fertile and fruitful.
definitions.example: to fatten land

definitions.definition: To become fertile and fruitful.
The opposite of a strike; a labor disruption where management refuses to allow workers into a plant to work even if they are willing.
The action of installing a lock to keep someone out of an area, such as eviction of a tenant by changing the lock.
(by extension) The exclusion of others from a certain place or situation.
definitions.example: It's another front-row lockout for Mercedes on the starting grid of the Japanese Grand Prix.

definitions.definition: A situation where the system is not responding to input.
A safety device designed to prevent touching a moving part when it is under operation.
The final portion of a weightlifting motion where all applicable limbs or joints are fully extended or "locked out".
An exercise meant to increase strength in the lockout portion of a lifting motion.
definitions.example: 2016, Christian Thibaudeau, “Tip: For Bigger Triceps, Do Heavy Lockouts”, T-Nation.

definitions.definition: To cease motion, activity, or progress:
A person who blabs; a tattler; a telltale.
To blather; to talk foolishly or incoherently.
To blab; to reveal a secret.
To stick out one's tongue.
To possess, own.
definitions.example: I have a house and a car.

definitions.definition: To hold, as something at someone's disposal.
definitions.example: Do you have the key? (not necessarily one's own key)

definitions.definition: Used to state the existence or presence of someone in a specified relationship with the subject.
definitions.example: I have a really mean boss.

definitions.definition: To partake of (a particular substance, especially food or drink, or action or activity).
definitions.example: Can I have a look at that?

definitions.definition: To be scheduled to attend, undertake or participate in.
definitions.example: Fred won't be able to come to the party; he has a meeting that day.

definitions.definition: To experience, go through, undergo.
definitions.example: He had surgery on his hip yesterday.

definitions.definition: To be afflicted with, suffer from.
definitions.example: He had a cold last week.

definitions.definition: (auxiliary verb, taking a past participle) Used in forming the perfect aspect.
definitions.example: I had already eaten.

definitions.definition: Used as an interrogative verb before a pronoun to form a tag question, echoing a previous use of 'have' as an auxiliary verb or, in certain cases, main verb. (For further discussion, see the appendix English tag questions.)
definitions.example: They haven't eaten dinner yet, have they?

definitions.definition: (auxiliary verb, taking a to-infinitive) See have to.
definitions.example: I have to go.

definitions.definition: To give birth to.
definitions.example: My mother had me when she was 25.

definitions.definition: To engage in sexual intercourse with.
definitions.example: He's always bragging about how many women he's had.

definitions.definition: To accept as a romantic partner.
definitions.example: Despite my protestations of love, she would not have me.

definitions.definition: (transitive with bare infinitive) To cause to, by a command, request or invitation.
definitions.example: They had me feed their dog while they were out of town.

definitions.definition: (transitive with adjective or adjective-phrase complement) To cause to be.
definitions.example: He had him arrested for trespassing.

definitions.definition: (transitive with bare infinitive) To be affected by an occurrence. (Used in supplying a topic that is not a verb argument.)
definitions.example: I've had three people today tell me my hair looks nice.

definitions.definition: (transitive with adjective or adjective-phrase complement) To depict as being.
definitions.example: Their stories differed; he said he'd been at work when the incident occurred, but her statement had him at home that entire evening.

definitions.definition: To defeat in a fight; take.
definitions.example: I could have him!

definitions.definition: (obsolete outside Ireland) To be able to speak (a language).
definitions.example: I have no German.

definitions.definition: To feel or be (especially painfully) aware of.
definitions.example: Dan certainly has arms today, probably from scraping paint off four columns the day before.

definitions.definition: To trick, to deceive.
definitions.example: You had me alright! I never would have thought that was just a joke.

definitions.definition: (often with present participle) To allow; to tolerate.
definitions.example: I asked my dad if I could go to the concert this Thursday, but he wouldn't have it since it's a school night.

definitions.definition: (often used in the negative) To believe, buy, be taken in by.
definitions.example: I made up an excuse as to why I was out so late, but my wife wasn't having any of it.

definitions.definition: To host someone; to take in as a guest.
definitions.example: Thank you for having me!

definitions.definition: To get a reading, measurement, or result from an instrument or calculation.
definitions.example: I have two contacts on my scope.

definitions.definition: (of a jury) To consider a court proceeding that has been completed; to begin deliberations on a case.
definitions.example: We'll schedule closing arguments for Thursday, and the jury will have the case by that afternoon.

definitions.definition: To make an observation of (a bird species).
An educational institute that teaches applied arts and sciences rather than academic subjects.
An exhibition of objects illustrating many arts.
The science of the mechanic arts.
A superscalar processor, architecture or pipeline.
(of a CPU architecture) Implementing instruction-level parallelism within a single processor, thereby allowing faster throughput than would otherwise be possible at the same clock speed.
An Italian starter for a meal; normally a cold assortment of salami, cheese, seafood and vegetables.
Related to holism.
Relating to a study of the whole instead of a separation into parts.
An elastic band worn to keep a glove from slipping off the wrist.
A decorative band or bracelet that encircles the wearer's wrist; especially, a closely knitted one to keep it warm; a muffetee.
A small handbag with a short strap for attaching it to the wearer's wrist.
A handcuff.
Audacious and unrestrained.
definitions.example: If you’re going to lie, you might as well tell a bodacious lie.

definitions.definition: Incorrigible and insolent.
definitions.example: You, sir, are a bodacious scoundrel.

definitions.definition: (US slang) Impressively great in size, and enormous; extraordinary.
(of a person) Sexy, attractive.
Bodaciously.
To warn or notify of a fault; to reprove gently or kindly, but seriously; to exhort.
To counsel against wrong practices; to caution or advise; to warn against danger or an offense; — followed by of, against, or a subordinate clause.
To instruct or direct; to inform; to notify.
To write something in collaboration with another author.
The development of specific antibodies in the blood serum as a result of infection or immunization
The state of being incumbent.
An obligation or duty
A tenure
Benefice, lucrative position or possession
A second crop of hay; aftermath.
A stubble field left unploughed until late in the autumn, so that it can be cropped by cattle.
Any of various wood-boring marine crustaceans of the genus Limnoria, especially Limnoria lignorum, which cause damage to underwater wooden structures.
To signify beyond its literal or principal meaning.
definitions.example: Racism often connotes an underlying fear or ignorance.

definitions.definition: To possess an inseparable related condition; to imply as a logical consequence.
definitions.example: Poverty connotes hunger.

definitions.definition: To express without overt reference; to imply.
To require as a logical predicate to consequence.

The zone of transition between the troposphere and the stratosphere (approximately 13 kilometers). The tropopause normally occurs at an altitude of between 25,000 and 45,000 feet in polar and temperate zones. It occurs at 55,000 feet in the tropics.
To become/get married to.
To accept, support, or take on as one’s own (an idea or a cause).
(of a woman) Having shapely and voluptuous curves; curvy.

In fortification: an indented parapet, formed by a series of rising members called cops or merlons, separated by openings called crenelles or embrasures, the soldier sheltering himself behind the merlon while he fires through the embrasure or through a loophole in the battlement.
Any high wall for defense.
The towering roof of heaven.
To exceed or overstep some limit or boundary.
To act in violation of some law.
(construed with against) To commit an offense; to sin.
(of the sea) To spread over land along a shoreline; to inundate.
To incline, deviate, or bend, from a vertical position; to be in a position thus inclining or deviating.
definitions.example: She leaned out of the window.

definitions.definition: To incline in opinion or desire; to conform in conduct; often with to, toward, etc.
definitions.example: I’m leaning towards voting Conservative in the next election.  The Hispanic vote leans Democratic.

definitions.definition: Followed by against, on, or upon: to rest or rely, for support, comfort, etc.
To hang outwards.
To press against.
The process of calculating a power by multiplying together a number of equal factors, where the exponent specifies the number of factors to multiply.
A mathematical problem involving exponentiation.
A person who talks too much or too loudly, especially in a boastful or self-important manner.
To become lank.
Slender or thin; not well filled out; not plump; shrunken; lean.
Meagre, paltry, scant in quantity.
(of hair) Straight and flat; thin and limp. (Often associated with being greasy.)
Languid; drooping, slack.
To turn into vapor.
The office, or the term of a governor.
To impose a fee for the use of.
definitions.example: Once more it is proposed to toll the East River bridges.

definitions.definition: To levy a toll on (someone or something).
To take as a toll.
To pay a toll or tallage.
To ring (a bell) slowly and repeatedly.
definitions.example: Ask not for whom the bell tolls.

definitions.definition: To summon by ringing a bell.
definitions.example: The ringer tolled the workers back from the fields for vespers.

definitions.definition: To announce by tolling.
definitions.example: The bells tolled the King’s death.

definitions.definition: To draw; pull; tug; drag.
To tear in pieces.
To draw; entice; invite; allure.
definitions.example: Hou many virgins shal she tolle and drawe to þe Lord - "Life of Our Lady"

definitions.definition: To lure with bait; tole (especially, fish and animals).
To take away; to vacate; to annul.
To suspend.
definitions.example: The statute of limitations defense was tolled as a result of the defendant’s wrongful conduct.

definitions.definition: Any fungus in the genus Claviceps which are parasitic on grasses.
The sclerotium (wintering stage) of certain fungi in the genus Claviceps, appearing as a deformed grain in certain cereals and grasses infected by the fungi.

A small pouch, usually made of either fur or plain or fur-trimmed leather, which is worn, suspended from a belt or chain, on the front of a kilt and used to hold various items normally carried in trouser pockets.
Any large rod-shaped virus of the family Baculoviridae, including the granuloviruses and nucleopolyhedroviruses.
Like a zealot; with zealotry.
A person who has returned to the country of origin or whose citizenship has been restored.
To restore (a person) to his or her own country.
A firm or paved beach or slope convenient for hauling vessels out of the water.
A tyre whose compound is softer than superhards, and harder than mediums.
Crack cocaine.
Hard labor.
definitions.example: The prisoners were sentenced to three years' hard.

definitions.definition: The short coarser fibers of flax or hemp; tow.
Inflammation of the tissue of the lungs.
A collision between two or more aerospace vehicles in flight.
In the act of flight; airborne.
A widow holding property or title derived from her late husband
Any lady of dignified bearing
A fragment of RNA that can act as an enzyme.
To obscure by blurring; to smear.
To soil or smear with dirt.
To use dense smoke to protect from insects.
To stifle or smother with smoke.
To burn herbs as a cleansing ritual (suffumigation).
To subject to ritual burning of herbs (suffumigation, smudging).
The act of something being smudged.
A stain or smear left by something being smudged.
Suffumigation.
To scream with a shrill, prolonged sound.
To give sensitive information about someone to a third party; to rat on someone.
A postage stamp that is part of a thematic collection.
A surgeon specializing in brain surgery.
Containing or releasing serotonin
A geographical unit of land smaller than a parish.
A religious community whose members (especially nuns) live under strict observation of religious rules and self-imposed vows.
The buildings and pertaining surroundings in which such a community lives.
A Christian school.
A gathering of people lasting several days for the purpose of discussing or working on topics previously selected.
A coming together; a meeting.
Any of several diseases or infections caused by a trypanosome.
One who usurps.
A proteolytic enzyme in papaya fruit which can be used to tenderize meat.
Any trivalent chromosome
Having a valence of three.
(of a vaccine) Protecting against three different (usually flu) viruses.
The act of publicly reciting something previously memorized.
The material recited.
A regularly scheduled class, in a school, in which discussion occurs of the material covered in a parallel lecture.
(music) A part of a song's lyrics that is spoken rather than sung.
To teach by repeated instruction.
To induce understanding or a particular sentiment in a person or persons.
To load down something with a burden
To restrict or block something with a hindrance or impediment
To burden with a legal claim or other obligation
A contagious bacterial skin disease forming pustules and yellow crusty sores, chiefly on the face and hands. It is common in children and infection is often through cuts or insect bites.
Someone who tortures.
The currency of Greece in ancient times and again from 1832 until 2001, with the symbol ₯, since replaced by the euro.
A coin worth one drachma.
An Ancient Greek weight of about 66.5 grains, or 4.3 grams.
A later Greek weight equal to a gram.
To secure against loss or damage; to insure.
To compensate or reimburse someone for some expense or injury
To hurt, to harm
A system whereby students, visiting a foreign country to study, board with a local family at an affordable price.
A house used primarily as the residence of the owner but with the business of accommodating paying guests.
To compensate with payment; especially, to repay money spent on one's behalf.
definitions.example: The company will reimburse you for your expenses for the business trip.

definitions.definition: Someone who takes advantage of any opportunity to advance their own situation, placing expediency above principle.
Not designated.
Not impaired.
Flawed or damaged; unsound, liable to break apart; ramshackle.
Sickly, frail; diseased.
Of unsound mind; insane, demented.
definitions.example: His ideas were both frightening and crazy.

definitions.definition: Out of control.
definitions.example: When she gets on the motorcycle she goes crazy.

definitions.definition: Very excited or enthusiastic.
definitions.example: He went crazy when he won.

definitions.definition: In love; experiencing romantic feelings.
definitions.example: Why is she so crazy about him?

definitions.definition: Very unexpected; wildly surprising.
definitions.example: The game had a crazy ending.

definitions.definition: To perform the sacrament of baptism by sprinkling or pouring water over someone or immersing them in water.
To dedicate or christen.
Of rum, brandy, or any other spirits, to dilute with water.
To ensure proper burning of a joint by moistening the exterior with saliva.
Baptism
The condition of having keratin growing on the skin.
A political system in which society is organized into collective interest groups or "bodies" (Latin corpora) which are subservient to the state and act as organs of political representation.
A form of capitalism in which the government is lobbied by, or generally heavily favors, corporations at the expense of the general populace.
Trailing vine-like plants in the family Convolvulaceae with funnel-shaped flowers.
Plants of species in other families with similar appearance
Unaware, without noticing; inattentive; careless.
definitions.example: Sing we joyous, all together, heedless of the wind and weather.

definitions.definition: The deepest malignity or spite; deep-seated enmity or malice; inveterate hatred.
definitions.example: I could almost see the rancor in his eyes when he challenged me to a fight.

definitions.definition: Extending through more than one human culture.
Not culturally specific.
A waxy protuberance at the base of the upper beak in certain birds.
To wax; to cover or close with wax.
A supporter of Trotskyism.
Any of several animals related to Equus ferus caballus.
Equipment with legs.
Type of equipment.

A mass of earthy matter, or rock of the same character as the wall rock, occurring in the course of a vein, as of coal or ore; hence, to take horse (said of a vein) is to divide into branches for a distance.
The sedative, antidepressant, and anxiolytic drug morphine, chiefly when used illicitly.

An informal variant of basketball in which players match shots made by their opponent(s), each miss adding a letter to the word "horse", with 5 misses spelling the whole word and eliminating a player, until only the winner is left. Also HORSE, H-O-R-S-E or H.O.R.S.E. (see Variations of basketball#H-O-R-S-E).
(among students) A translation or other illegitimate aid in study or examination.
(among students) horseplay; tomfoolery
Heroin (drug).
definitions.example: Alright, mate, got any horse?

definitions.definition: An ugly old woman, a hag.
(chiefly of horses) A gait of a four-legged animal between walk and canter, a diagonal gait (in which diagonally opposite pairs of legs move together).
A gait of a person or animal faster than a walk but slower than a run.
A brisk journey or progression.
definitions.example: In this lesson we'll have a quick trot through Chapter 3 before moving on to Chapter 4.

definitions.definition: A toddler.
A young animal.
A moderately rapid dance.
A succession of heads thrown in a game of two-up.
(with "good" or "bad") A run of luck or fortune.
definitions.example: He′s had a good trot, but his luck will end soon.

definitions.definition: (as 'the trots') Diarrhoea.
definitions.example: He's got a bad case of the trots and has to keep running off to the toilet.

definitions.definition: Diarrhoea/diarrhea.
definitions.example: I've had the trots all morning and haven't been able to go out.

definitions.definition: (with "the") A trotting race meet; harness racing.
To move along briskly; specifically, to move at a pace between a walk and a run.
definitions.example: I didn't want to miss my bus, so I trotted the last few hundred yards to the stop.

definitions.definition: (of a horse) To move at a gait between a walk and a canter.
To cause to move, as a horse or other animal, in the pace called a trot; to cause to run without galloping or cantering.
Pertaining to divine providence.
Fortunate, as if occurring through the intervention of Providence.
A Roman sword roughly two feet long.
A pen, a hard internal bodypart of certain cephalopods, made of chitin-like material.
A person qualified to make or repair boilers.
A whiskey with a beer chaser.
A calculation of an estimate of the value of some function outside the range of known values.
An inference about some hypothetical situation based on known facts.
The diametric opposite of interpolation.
